docs.text:
Introduction


These are the specifications developed by the 
Local Waste Service Standards Project
.


Design principles


The project will follow the 
API design guidance
 from the 
Government Service Design Manual
.


Standards


These technical specifications are used where relevant:




The API is documented using 
RAML
.


The APIs make use of 
JSON-LD
.


Object models use 
JSON Schema
.


JSON Table Schema
 are used for table definitions.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: These are the specifications developed by the  Local Waste Service Standards Project .
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: The project will follow the  API design guidance  from the  Government Service Design Manual .
docs.title: Design principles

docs.text: These technical specifications are used where relevant:   The API is documented using  RAML .  The APIs make use of  JSON-LD .  Object models use  JSON Schema .  JSON Table Schema  are used for table definitions.
docs.title: Standards

docs.text:
Data models


This gives an overview of the data models:








Model


Description










Waste service


A waste or recycling service provided by the council for citizens.






Round plan


A truck collecting one or more material streams from a set of containers on a repeating schedule.






Round


An instance of a round plan that has been executed on a particular date.






Waste event


An issue or check that is recorded during a round.






Container


Where materials are stored for collection.






Material stream


The types of materials that can be collected.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: This gives an overview of the data models:     Model  Description      Waste service  A waste or recycling service provided by the council for citizens.    Round plan  A truck collecting one or more material streams from a set of containers on a repeating schedule.    Round  An instance of a round plan that has been executed on a particular date.    Waste event  An issue or check that is recorded during a round.    Container  Where materials are stored for collection.    Material stream  The types of materials that can be collected.
docs.title: Data models

docs.text:
Waste service


Use cases and requirements


The Service model should have properties for:


name




For identification.




frequency




An indication of typically how often the collection is run.




description




For specific instructions about the service, such as when and where to put containers out, that bin lids must be closed, etc.




next collections




To know upcoming dates of when upcoming collections will happen, when filtered by property.




previous collections




To know when the last few collections have taken place, when filtered by property.




container types




What types of containers (and in relation, materials) are collected by this service.




rounds




The schedules and routes of trucks collecting the materials handled by this service.




Types


This WasteService type:




Is a derivation of the 
Service concept
 in the Smart City Concept Model.


Extends from the 
GovernmentService
 schema.org type.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










name


Text


Name of the service.






frequency


Text


How often it runs, e.g. weekly.






description


schema:description


A short description of the service.






next collections


Date


List of dates of next collections.






previous collections


Date


List of dates of previous collections.






container types


Container type


The container types that are collected.






available channel


schema:availableChannel


A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).






provider


schema:provider


The council providing the service.






service area


schema:serviceArea


The geographic area where the service is provided.






service operator


schema:serviceOperator


The operator of the service, if different to the provider.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@type": "WasteService",
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Mixed recycling",
  "frequency": "weekly",
  "container_types": [
    {
      "color": "black",
      "size": "240L",
      "shape": "wheelie bin",
      "lid_color": "green",
      "material_stream": {
        "name": "Mixed recyclables",
        "@id": "/waste/material-streams/mixed-recycling"
      },
      "image": ""
    },
    {
      "color": "brown",
      "size": "40L",
      "shape": "caddy",
      "material_stream": {
        "name": "Food waste",
        "@id": "/waste/material-streams/food-waste"
      },
      "image": ""
    }
  ],
  "description": "Please put your recycling wheelie bin on the street.",
  "next_collection": "1 August 2014",
  "last_collection": "23 July 2015",
  "esd_url": "http://id.esd.org.uk/service/1130",

  "events": [
    {
      "@type": "WasteEvent",
      "@id": "/api/events/1",
      "type": "Not presented",
      "date_created": "1 August 2015",
      "uprn": "123456789012",
      "usrn": "123456789012",
      "image": "http://example.com/images/123.png",
      "geo": {
        "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
        "latitude": "40.75",
        "longitude": "73.98"
      },
      "container_color": "black",
      "round": "/rounds/123"
    }
  ],
  "available_channel": {
    "@type": "ServiceChannel",
    "name": "Household waste and street maintenance",
    "service_phone": {
      "@type": "ContactPoint",
      "telephone": "0123456789",
      "email": "waste@example.gov.uk"
    },
    "service_url": "http://www.example.gov.uk/waste"
  },
  "provider": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Example Council",
    "url": "http://www.example.gov.uk"
  },
  "service_area": {
    "@type": "AdministrativeArea",
    "name": "Anytown"
  },
  "service_operator": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Example Waste Operator Co"
  }
}

docs.text:
Round plan


Use cases and requirements


The Round model should have properties for:


date




When this round took place.




round plan




A reference to which Round plan was used.




events




Any related events that have been recorded.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@id": "/rounds/456",
  "date": "",
  "plan": {
    "id": "",
    "start_date": "",
    "rrule": "",
    "containers": "/api/containers?round_plan=1"
  },
  "events": "/api/events?round=456"
}
docs.title: Round

docs.text: The Round model should have properties for:  date   When this round took place.   round plan   A reference to which Round plan was used.   events   Any related events that have been recorded.

The Round plan model should have properties for:

repeating rule

Term


Mapping


Definition










Serialisation

}

Container


Use cases and requirements


The Container model should have properties for:

For the common properties of the container.




serial number or ID




For identification of the container.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










id




Unique identifer.






type




The type of container.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{

}

docs.text:
Container type


Use cases and requirements


The Container type model should have properties for:


color




The general color.




size




Typically in litres.




shape




Wheelie bin, box, caddy, etc.




lid color




In case its different to the body color.




material stream




What kind of waste the container is used for.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










id




Unique identifer.






color


schema:color


General color as a hex value.






size


integer


Size in litres.






shape


text


The shape or type of the container.






lid color


schema:color


Lid-specific color as a hex value.






material stream












Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "color": "#fff",
  "shape": "wheelie bin",
  "size": "240",
  "material_stream": {
    "name": "mixed recyclables",
    "@id": "/api/material-streams/mixed-recyclables"
  }
}

    

  






Codelists


Container shape

docs.text:
Waste event


Use cases and requirements


The Event model should have properties for:


event type




What kind of event it is.




start date




Know when an event happened.




UPRN




For recording against specific properties.




USRN




For recording street-level events.




coordinates




For easy geolocation of where the event was recorded.




image




Visual evidence of an issue.




comments




For any additional information useful to record.




round




The round where this event happened.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










type


string


A categorisation of the event.






start date


string


When the event was took place.






uprn


string


A unique identifier for a property.






usrn


string


A unique identifier for a street.






geo


schema:geo


The location in WGS84 datum.






image


schema:image


A URL to a related image.






round


URL


The URL of the round where this event was recorded.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@type": "WasteEvent",
  "@id": "/api/events/1",
  "type": "Not presented",
  "date_created": "2014-05-23T20:00",
  "uprn": "123456789012",
  "usrn": "123456789012",
  "image": "http://example.com/images/123.png",
  "geo": {
    "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
    "latitude": "40.75",
    "longitude": "73.98"
  },
  "round": "/rounds/123"
}

docs.text:
Material stream


Use cases and requirements


The Material stream model should have properties for:


name




What kind of material it is.




image




For clear identification, matching physical signage.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










name


string


The name of the material.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "name": "Mixed recycling"
}

docs.text: The Material stream model should have properties for:  name   What kind of material it is.   image   For clear identification, matching physical signage.

docs.text: Term  Mapping  Definition      name  string  The name of the material.
docs.title: Properties
Serialisation

docs.text:
Place


Use cases and requirements


The Address model should have properties for:


address fields


e.g. street, locality, country, postcode.




To provide basic address information that everyone understands.




UPRN




To link an address to the property universal ID.




USRN




To identify the street where the property is located.




geo




To be able to plot locations on maps.




Types


This maps to the schema.org Place type with some extended fields.


Properties








Term


Mapping


Definition










address


schema:address


Physical address of the item.






uprn


Text


A unique identifier for a property.






usrn


Text


A unique identifier for a street.






geo


schema:geo


The location in WGS84 datum.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "@type": "Place",
  "@id": "/places/1",
  "address": {
    "street_address": "1 Acacia Avenue",
    "locality": "Anytown",
    "region": "Anyshire",
    "postcode": "AB1 2CD"
  },
  "geo": {
    "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
    "latitude": "40.75",
    "longitude": "73.98"
  },
  "uprn": "123456789012",
  "usrn": "123456789012"
}

UPRN   To link an address to the property universal ID.   USRN   To identify the street where the property is located.   geo   To be able to plot locations on maps.

docs.text:
Missed collections reasons


The table below lists a set of common possible events that can occur during a waste collection round.


Many council classifications also divide event types by the service or container type. It is assumed here that it will be possible to categorise the events by:




service type


property or street









  
ID

  
Name

  
Parent

  
Type
1

  
Description

  
Synonyms






  

  
Not presented

  

  
service

  
The container was not presented on the street.

  
Non-Presentation






  

  
Incorrectly presented

  

  
service

  

  






  

  
Too heavy

  

  
service

  
The container was too heavy to empty.

  
Overweight Bin






  

  
Lid open

  

  
service

  
The container was too full, the lid would not close properly.

  
Overflowing Bin / Lid up






  

  
Side waste present

  

  
service

  
Extra refuse was present at the side of the bins.

  
Sidewaste






  

  
Contamination

  

  
service

  
The contents was contaminated.

  






  

  
Food waste

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with food waste

  






  

  
Garden waste

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with garden waste

  






  

  
Refuse waste

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with refuse waste

  






  

  
Bulky waste

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with bulky waste

  






  

  
Rubble/DIY

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with rubble

  






  

  
Commercial

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with commercial waste

  






  

  
Turf/soil

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with turf or soil

  






  

  
Animal bedding

  
Contamination

  
service

  
Contaminated with animal bedding

  






  

  
Inaccessible container store

  

  
service

  
It was not possible to access the bins.

  
Inaccessible Bin Store






  

  
Container damaged

  

  
service

  
A bin was damaged.

  
Bin damaged






  

  
Container lost in vehicle

  

  
service

  
A bin was lost inside the vehicle.

  
Receptacle Lost in Vehicle






  

  
Not on scheme

  

  
service

  
The property was not on the service.

  






  

  
Inaccessible road

  

  
service

  
The road could not be accessed.

  






  

  
Road closure

  

  
service

  
The road was closed.

  






  

  
Querying assisted

  

  
service

  

  






  

  
Street completed

  

  
general

  
All properties on this street have been visited.

  






  

  
Blocked by vehicles

  

  
general

  
A street cannot be accessed due to vehicles blocking access.

  






  

  
Roadworks

  

  
general

  
Roadworks are blocking the street.

  






  

  
Gate locked

  

  
general

  
A street cannot be accessed due to a gate being locked.

  






  

  
Part access

  

  
general

  

  






  

  
Partly completed street

  

  
general

  

  






  

  
Alarm activated

  

  
general

  
A vehicle alarm was activated.

  






  

  
Breakdown

  

  
general

  
The waste collection truck broke down.

  










Here "service" means an event type that is applied to a specific service, e.g. refuse, recycling, etc and often relates to the containers. "General" is for event types where the event is not specifically tied to a service but could affect any service
docs.title: Missed collections

docs.text:
The table below lists a set of common possible events that can occur during a waste collection round.  Many council classifications also divide event types by the service or container type. It is assumed here that it will be possible to categorise the events by:   service type  property or street     
   ID 
   Name 
   Parent 
   Type 1 
   Description 
   Synonyms   
   
   Not presented 
   
   service 
   The container was not presented on the street. 
   Non-Presentation   
   
   Incorrectly presented 
   
   service 
   
     
   
   Too heavy 
   
   service 
   The container was too heavy to empty. 
   Overweight Bin   
   
   Lid open 
   
   service 
   The container was too full, the lid would not close properly. 
   Overflowing Bin / Lid up   
   
   Side waste present 
   
   service 
   Extra refuse was present at the side of the bins. 
   Sidewaste   
   
   Contamination 
   
   service 
   The contents was contaminated. 
     
   
   Food waste 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with food waste 
     
   
   Garden waste 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with garden waste 
     
   
   Refuse waste 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with refuse waste 
     
   
   Bulky waste 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with bulky waste 
     
   
   Rubble/DIY 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with rubble 
     
   
   Commercial 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with commercial waste 
     
   
   Turf/soil 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with turf or soil 
     
   
   Animal bedding 
   Contamination 
   service 
   Contaminated with animal bedding 
     
   
   Inaccessible container store 
   
   service 
   It was not possible to access the bins. 
   Inaccessible Bin Store   
   
   Container damaged 
   
   service 
   A bin was damaged. 
   Bin damaged   
   
   Container lost in vehicle 
   
   service 
   A bin was lost inside the vehicle. 
   Receptacle Lost in Vehicle   
   
   Not on scheme 
   
   service 
   The property was not on the service. 
     
   
   Inaccessible road 
   
   service 
   The road could not be accessed. 
     
   
   Road closure 
   
   service 
   The road was closed. 
     
   
   Querying assisted 
   
   service 
   
     
   
   Street completed 
   
   general 
   All properties on this street have been visited. 
     
   
   Blocked by vehicles 
   
   general 
   A street cannot be accessed due to vehicles blocking access. 
     
   
   Roadworks 
   
   general 
   Roadworks are blocking the street. 
     
   
   Gate locked 
   
   general 
   A street cannot be accessed due to a gate being locked. 
     
   
   Part access 
   
   general 
   
     
   
   Partly completed street 
   
   general 
   
     
   
   Alarm activated 
   
   general 
   A vehicle alarm was activated. 
     
   
   Breakdown 
   
   general 
   The waste collection truck broke down. 
       Here "service" means an event type that is applied to a specific service, e.g. refuse, recycling, etc and often relates to the containers. "General" is for event types where the event is not specifically tied to a service but could affect any service

docs.title: Material streams

docs.text:
Waste Services API


Introduction


This API offers a core set of resources and operations for interacting with local council waste and recycling services.


ESD Standards


The 
ESD Standards
 define all the categories of services that local authorities typically provide. These will be referenced via URL from the Services API, to allow individual council instances of a service to be matched to common service definitions.


Services




Get a list of waste services



  
get

  
/services





Response


[
  {
    
id
: 1,
    
frequency
: 
weekly
,
    
description
: 
Please put your recycling box on the street.
,
    
name
: 
Recycling service
,
    
esd_url
: 
http://id.esd.org.uk/service/524

  },
  {
    
id
: 2,
    
frequency
: 
weekly
,
    
description
: 
Black bins.
,
    
name
: 
Refuse
,
    
esd_url
: 
http://id.esd.org.uk/service/525

  }
]






Get a single service



  
get

  
/services/{serviceId}





Response


{
  
description
: 
Please put your recycling wheelie bin on the street.
,
  
container_types
: [
    {
      
color
: 
black
,
      
image
: 
,
      
material_stream
: {
        
@id
: 
/waste/material-streams/mixed-recycling
,
        
name
: 
Mixed recyclables

      },
      
shape
: 
wheelie bin
,
      
lid_color
: 
green
,
      
size
: 
240L

    },
    {
      
color
: 
brown
,
      
material_stream
: {
        
@id
: 
/waste/material-streams/food-waste
,
        
name
: 
Food waste

      },
      
shape
: 
caddy
,
      
image
: 
,
      
size
: 
40L

    }
  ],
  
@type
: 
WasteService
,
  
service_operator
: {
    
@type
: 
Organization
,
    
name
: 
Example Waste Operator Co

  },
  
service_area
: {
    
@type
: 
AdministrativeArea
,
    
name
: 
Anytown

  },
  
name
: 
Mixed recycling
,
  
events
: [
    {
      
type
: 
Not presented
,
      
usrn
: 
123456789012
,
      
@id
: 
/api/events/1
,
      
image
: 
http://example.com/images/123.png
,
      
@type
: 
WasteEvent
,
      
uprn
: 
123456789012
,

: 
1 August 2015
,

: {
        
latitude
: 
40.75
,
        
@type
: 
GeoCoordinates
,
        
longitude
: 
73.98

      },
      
round
: 
/rounds/123
,

: 
black

    }
  ],

: 
1 August 2014
,

: 
weekly
,

: {

: 
http://www.example.gov.uk/waste
,

: {
      
telephone
: 
0123456789
,
      
email
: 
waste@example.gov.uk
,
      
@type
: 
ContactPoint

    },

: 
Household waste and street maintenance
,
    
@type
:

url
: 
http://www.example.gov.uk
,
    
@type
: 
Organization
,

Example Council

  },

: 
23 July 2015
,
  
id
: 1,
  
esd_url
: 
http://id.esd.org.uk/service/1130

}




Events




Get a list of events



  
get

  
/events





Query parameters








Name


Type


Description










page


number








uprn


string


Limit results to those related to the property with this UPRN.






usrn


string


Limit results to those related to the street with this USRN.






type


string


Limit results to those with a matching type, e.g. "Not presented".






start_date


date


Limit results to those created on or after this start date.






end_date


date


Limit results to those created before this end date.






round


string


Limit results to those recorded against this round.








Response


[
  {
    
event_type
: 
Not presented
,
    
usrn
: 
123456789012
,
    
image
: 
http://example.com/images/123.png
,
    
uprn
: 
123456789012
,
    
date_created
: 
2014-05-23T20:00
,
    
geo
: {
      
latitude
: 
40.75
,
      
@type
: 
GeoCoordinates
,
      
longitude
: 
73.98

    }
  },
  {
    
event_type
: 
Too heavy
,
    
usrn
: 
123456789012
,
    
image
: 
http://example.com/images/123.png
,
    
uprn
: 
123456789012
,
    
date_created
: 
2014-05-23T20:00
,
    
geo
: {
      
latitude
: 
45.75
,
      
@type
: 
GeoCoordinates
,
      
longitude
: 
53.98

    }
  }
]

get

  
/events/{eventId}

123456789012

2014-05-23T20:00
,

: 
40.75
,
    
@type
: 
GeoCoordinates
,
    
longitude
: 
73.98

  },

: 
/rounds/123

}




Rounds




Get a list of rounds



  
get

  
/rounds





Response


{}






Get a single round



  
get

  
/rounds/{roundId}





Response
